msbt.message: That thing's claws are really sharp, huh? And how do you say its name? Is itdeinonychus? More like deiNOPEnychus if you ask me.
Everything must have been bigger back in the dinosaur times, right? Like, just look at this giant deer. It's straight-up giant!
So, this is a pteranodon It looks kinda rough now, but I bet it was majestic in its time. Probably the of the sky!
It's the most terrifying dinosaur of all timeT. Rex!Too bad about that name though. I could have come up with something more scary.
I think this dinosaur was a peaceful, plant-eating one, but MAN! Look at those plates! You could cut right in half with one of those bad boys!
It's hard to imagine that creatures this large were just walking around, minding their own business
Yo, those are some pointy tusks! I'd probably poke myself constantly if I had tusks like that.
This thing HAD to be the smile champion of its time. Just look at those big, beautiful chompers!
Wait, so this is a eusthenopter- WHAT? <10_4 />With confusing branding like that, no wonder it went extinct.
They say that the dunkleosteus got its name from how hard it would dunk on smaller fish. Just kidding! It's from how it would dunk proto-donuts in its mesozoic mocha every morning.
So this is a QuetQuetzaQuetzal It's my pal Q!
Really? REALLY? We're calling this a fossil now?This explains how horrible fashions can come back into style just because they're super old
Is this really an ancient creature?I'm sure I have, like, eleven of these guys scurrying around my basement right now.
Heydid YOU donate that fossil? And I'm here lecturing you about it like a know-it-all. So cool!
Uhhthat kinda looks like my uncle. But it can't be, right? This thing is, like, thousands of years old. Then again, Uncle Joe is pretty wrinkly
